Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input_id.description: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `mysample;mysample`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The ID of the sample being processed
input_id.help_text: Type: List of `string`, required, example: `mysample;mysample`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The ID of the sample being processed. This vector should have the same length as the `--input_r1` argument.

input_r1.description: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `mysample_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz;mysample_S1_L002_R1_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Paths to the sequences to be mapped
input_r1.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `mysample_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz;mysample_S1_L002_R1_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Paths to the sequences to be mapped. If using Illumina paired-end reads, only the R1 files should be passed.

input_r2.description: Type: List of `file`, example: `mysample_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz;mysample_S1_L002_R2_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Paths to the sequences to be mapped
input_r2.help_text: Type: List of `file`, example: `mysample_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz;mysample_S1_L002_R2_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. Paths to the sequences to be mapped. If using Illumina paired-end reads, only the R2 files should be passed.

reference_index.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `/path/to/reference`. Path to the reference built by star_build_reference
reference_index.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `/path/to/reference`. Path to the reference built by star_build_reference. Corresponds to the --genomeDir argument in the STAR command.

reference_gtf.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `genes.gtf`. Path to the gtf reference file
reference_gtf.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `genes.gtf`. Path to the gtf reference file.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `/path/to/foo`. Path to output directory
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output.output`, example: `/path/to/foo`. Path to output directory. Corresponds to the --outFileNamePrefix argument in the STAR command.

run_htseq_count.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether or not to also run htseq-count after STAR
run_htseq_count.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether or not to also run htseq-count after STAR.

run_multiqc.description: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether or not to also run MultiQC at the end
run_multiqc.help_text: Type: `boolean`, default: `true`. Whether or not to also run MultiQC at the end.

min_success_rate.description: Type: `double`, default: `0.5`. Fail when the success rate is below this threshold
min_success_rate.help_text: Type: `double`, default: `0.5`. Fail when the success rate is below this threshold.

runRNGseed.description: Type: `integer`, example: `777`. random number generator seed
runRNGseed.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `777`. random number generator seed.

genomeFastaFiles.description: Type: List of `file`, multiple_sep: `";"`. path(s) to the fasta files with the genome sequences, separated by spaces
genomeFastaFiles.help_text:
Type: List of `file`, multiple_sep: `";"`. path(s) to the fasta files with the genome sequences, separated by spaces. These files should be plain text FASTA files, they *cannot* be zipped.

Required for the genome generation (--runMode genomeGenerate). Can also be used in the mapping (--runMode alignReads) to add extra (new) sequences to the genome (e.g. spike-ins).

sjdbFileChrStartEnd.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. path to the files with genomic coordinates (chr <tab> start <tab> end <tab> strand) for the splice junction introns
sjdbFileChrStartEnd.help_text: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. path to the files with genomic coordinates (chr <tab> start <tab> end <tab> strand) for the splice junction introns. Multiple files can be supplied and will be concatenated.

sjdbGTFfile.description: Type: `file`. path to the GTF file with annotations
sjdbGTFfile.help_text: Type: `file`. path to the GTF file with annotations

sjdbGTFchrPrefix.description: Type: `string`. prefix for chromosome names in a GTF file (e
sjdbGTFchrPrefix.help_text: Type: `string`. prefix for chromosome names in a GTF file (e.g. 'chr' for using ENSMEBL annotations with UCSC genomes)

sjdbGTFfeatureExon.description: Type: `string`, example: `exon`. feature type in GTF file to be used as exons for building transcripts
sjdbGTFfeatureExon.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `exon`. feature type in GTF file to be used as exons for building transcripts

sjdbGTFtagExonParentTranscript.description: Type: `string`, example: `transcript_id`. GTF attribute name for parent transcript ID (default "transcript_id" works for GTF files)
sjdbGTFtagExonParentTranscript.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `transcript_id`. GTF attribute name for parent transcript ID (default "transcript_id" works for GTF files)

sjdbGTFtagExonParentGene.description: Type: `string`, example: `gene_id`. GTF attribute name for parent gene ID (default "gene_id" works for GTF files)
sjdbGTFtagExonParentGene.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `gene_id`. GTF attribute name for parent gene ID (default "gene_id" works for GTF files)

sjdbGTFtagExonParentGeneName.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_name`, multiple_sep: `";"`. GTF attribute name for parent gene name
sjdbGTFtagExonParentGeneName.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_name`, multiple_sep: `";"`. GTF attribute name for parent gene name

sjdbGTFtagExonParentGeneType.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_type;gene_biotype`, multiple_sep: `";"`. GTF attribute name for parent gene type
sjdbGTFtagExonParentGeneType.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_type;gene_biotype`, multiple_sep: `";"`. GTF attribute name for parent gene type

sjdbOverhang.description: Type: `integer`, example: `100`. length of the donor/acceptor sequence on each side of the junctions, ideally = (mate_length - 1)
sjdbOverhang.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `100`. length of the donor/acceptor sequence on each side of the junctions, ideally = (mate_length - 1)

sjdbScore.description: Type: `integer`, example: `2`. extra alignment score for alignments that cross database junctions
sjdbScore.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `2`. extra alignment score for alignments that cross database junctions

sjdbInsertSave.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Basic`. which files to save when sjdb junctions are inserted on the fly at the mapping step

- Basic
sjdbInsertSave.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Basic`. which files to save when sjdb junctions are inserted on the fly at the mapping step

- Basic ... only small junction / transcript files
- All   ... all files including big Genome, SA and SAindex - this will create a complete genome directory

varVCFfile.description: Type: `string`. path to the VCF file that contains variation data
varVCFfile.help_text: Type: `string`. path to the VCF file that contains variation data. The 10th column should contain the genotype information, e.g. 0/1

readFilesType.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Fastx`. format of input read files

- Fastx
readFilesType.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Fastx`. format of input read files

- Fastx       ... FASTA or FASTQ
- SAM SE      ... SAM or BAM single-end reads; for BAM use --readFilesCommand samtools view
- SAM PE      ... SAM or BAM paired-end reads; for BAM use --readFilesCommand samtools view

readFilesSAMattrKeep.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `All`, multiple_sep: `";"`. for --readFilesType SAM SE/PE, which SAM tags to keep in the output BAM, e
readFilesSAMattrKeep.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `All`, multiple_sep: `";"`. for --readFilesType SAM SE/PE, which SAM tags to keep in the output BAM, e.g.: --readFilesSAMtagsKeep RG PL

- All     ... keep all tags
- None    ... do not keep any tags

readFilesManifest.description: Type: `file`. path to the "manifest" file with the names of read files
readFilesManifest.help_text:
Type: `file`. path to the "manifest" file with the names of read files. The manifest file should contain 3 tab-separated columns:

paired-end reads: read1_file_name $tab$ read2_file_name $tab$ read_group_line.
single-end reads: read1_file_name $tab$ -               $tab$ read_group_line.
Spaces, but not tabs are allowed in file names.
If read_group_line does not start with ID:, it can only contain one ID field, and ID: will be added to it.
If read_group_line starts with ID:, it can contain several fields separated by $tab$, and all fields will be be copied verbatim into SAM @RG header line.

readFilesPrefix.description: Type: `string`. prefix for the read files names, i
readFilesPrefix.help_text: Type: `string`. prefix for the read files names, i.e. it will be added in front of the strings in --readFilesIn

readFilesCommand.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. command line to execute for each of the input file
readFilesCommand.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. command line to execute for each of the input file. This command should generate FASTA or FASTQ text and send it to stdout

For example: zcat - to uncompress .gz files, bzcat - to uncompress .bz2 files, etc.

readMapNumber.description:
Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. number of reads to map from the beginning of the file

-1: map all reads
readMapNumber.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. number of reads to map from the beginning of the file

-1: map all reads

readMatesLengthsIn.description: Type: `string`, example: `NotEqual`. Equal/NotEqual - lengths of names,sequences,qualities for both mates are the same  / not the same
readMatesLengthsIn.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `NotEqual`. Equal/NotEqual - lengths of names,sequences,qualities for both mates are the same  / not the same. NotEqual is safe in all situations.

readNameSeparator.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `/`, multiple_sep: `";"`. character(s) separating the part of the read names that will be trimmed in output (read name after space is always trimmed)
readNameSeparator.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `/`, multiple_sep: `";"`. character(s) separating the part of the read names that will be trimmed in output (read name after space is always trimmed)

readQualityScoreBase.description: Type: `integer`, example: `33`. number to be subtracted from the ASCII code to get Phred quality score
readQualityScoreBase.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `33`. number to be subtracted from the ASCII code to get Phred quality score

clipAdapterType.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Hamming`. adapter clipping type

- Hamming
clipAdapterType.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Hamming`. adapter clipping type

- Hamming ... adapter clipping based on Hamming distance, with the number of mismatches controlled by --clip5pAdapterMMp
- CellRanger4 ... 5p and 3p adapter clipping similar to CellRanger4. Utilizes Opal package by Martin Sosic: https://github.com/Martinsos/opal
- None ... no adapter clipping, all other clip* parameters are disregarded

clip3pNbases.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. number(s) of bases to clip from 3p of each mate
clip3pNbases.help_text: Type: List of `integer`, example: `0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. number(s) of bases to clip from 3p of each mate. If one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

clip3pAdapterSeq.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. adapter sequences to clip from 3p of each mate
clip3pAdapterSeq.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. adapter sequences to clip from 3p of each mate.  If one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

- polyA ... polyA sequence with the length equal to read length

clip3pAdapterMMp.description: Type: List of `double`, example: `0.1`, multiple_sep: `";"`. max proportion of mismatches for 3p adapter clipping for each mate
clip3pAdapterMMp.help_text: Type: List of `double`, example: `0.1`, multiple_sep: `";"`. max proportion of mismatches for 3p adapter clipping for each mate.  If one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

clip3pAfterAdapterNbases.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. number of bases to clip from 3p of each mate after the adapter clipping
clip3pAfterAdapterNbases.help_text: Type: List of `integer`, example: `0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. number of bases to clip from 3p of each mate after the adapter clipping. If one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

clip5pNbases.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. number(s) of bases to clip from 5p of each mate
clip5pNbases.help_text: Type: List of `integer`, example: `0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. number(s) of bases to clip from 5p of each mate. If one value is given, it will be assumed the same for both mates.

limitGenomeGenerateRAM.description: Type: `long`, example: `31000000000`. maximum available RAM (bytes) for genome generation
limitGenomeGenerateRAM.help_text: Type: `long`, example: `31000000000`. maximum available RAM (bytes) for genome generation

limitIObufferSize.description: Type: List of `long`, example: `30000000;50000000`, multiple_sep: `";"`. max available buffers size (bytes) for input/output, per thread
limitIObufferSize.help_text: Type: List of `long`, example: `30000000;50000000`, multiple_sep: `";"`. max available buffers size (bytes) for input/output, per thread

limitOutSAMoneReadBytes.description: Type: `long`, example: `100000`. max size of the SAM record (bytes) for one read
limitOutSAMoneReadBytes.help_text: Type: `long`, example: `100000`. max size of the SAM record (bytes) for one read. Recommended value: >(2*(LengthMate1+LengthMate2+100)*outFilterMultimapNmax

limitOutSJoneRead.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. max number of junctions for one read (including all multi-mappers)
limitOutSJoneRead.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. max number of junctions for one read (including all multi-mappers)

limitOutSJcollapsed.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1000000`. max number of collapsed junctions
limitOutSJcollapsed.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1000000`. max number of collapsed junctions

limitBAMsortRAM.description: Type: `long`, example: `0`. maximum available RAM (bytes) for sorting BAM
limitBAMsortRAM.help_text: Type: `long`, example: `0`. maximum available RAM (bytes) for sorting BAM. If =0, it will be set to the genome index size. 0 value can only be used with --genomeLoad NoSharedMemory option.

limitSjdbInsertNsj.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1000000`. maximum number of junctions to be inserted to the genome on the fly at the mapping stage, including those from annotations and those detected in the 1st step of the 2-pass run
limitSjdbInsertNsj.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1000000`. maximum number of junctions to be inserted to the genome on the fly at the mapping stage, including those from annotations and those detected in the 1st step of the 2-pass run

limitNreadsSoft.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. soft limit on the number of reads
limitNreadsSoft.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. soft limit on the number of reads

outTmpKeep.description:
Type: `string`. whether to keep the temporary files after STAR runs is finished

- None
outTmpKeep.help_text:
Type: `string`. whether to keep the temporary files after STAR runs is finished

- None ... remove all temporary files
- All ... keep all files

outStd.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Log`. which output will be directed to stdout (standard out)

- Log
outStd.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Log`. which output will be directed to stdout (standard out)

- Log                    ... log messages
- SAM                    ... alignments in SAM format (which normally are output to Aligned.out.sam file), normal standard output will go into Log.std.out
- BAM_Unsorted           ... alignments in BAM format, unsorted. Requires --outSAMtype BAM Unsorted
- BAM_SortedByCoordinate ... alignments in BAM format, sorted by coordinate. Requires --outSAMtype BAM SortedByCoordinate
- BAM_Quant              ... alignments to transcriptome in BAM format, unsorted. Requires --quantMode TranscriptomeSAM

outReadsUnmapped.description: Type: `string`. output of unmapped and partially mapped (i
outReadsUnmapped.help_text:
Type: `string`. output of unmapped and partially mapped (i.e. mapped only one mate of a paired end read) reads in separate file(s).

- None    ... no output
- Fastx   ... output in separate fasta/fastq files, Unmapped.out.mate1/2

outQSconversionAdd.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. add this number to the quality score (e
outQSconversionAdd.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. add this number to the quality score (e.g. to convert from Illumina to Sanger, use -31)

outMultimapperOrder.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Old_2.4`. order of multimapping alignments in the output files

- Old_2
outMultimapperOrder.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Old_2.4`. order of multimapping alignments in the output files

- Old_2.4             ... quasi-random order used before 2.5.0
- Random              ... random order of alignments for each multi-mapper. Read mates (pairs) are always adjacent, all alignment for each read stay together. This option will become default in the future releases.

outSAMmode.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Full`. mode of SAM output

- None
outSAMmode.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Full`. mode of SAM output

- None ... no SAM output
- Full ... full SAM output
- NoQS ... full SAM but without quality scores

outSAMstrandField.description:
Type: `string`. Cufflinks-like strand field flag

- None
outSAMstrandField.help_text:
Type: `string`. Cufflinks-like strand field flag

- None        ... not used
- intronMotif ... strand derived from the intron motif. This option changes the output alignments: reads with inconsistent and/or non-canonical introns are filtered out.

outSAMattributes.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `Standard`, multiple_sep: `";"`. a string of desired SAM attributes, in the order desired for the output SAM
outSAMattributes.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Standard`, multiple_sep: `";"`. a string of desired SAM attributes, in the order desired for the output SAM. Tags can be listed in any combination/order.

***Presets:
- None        ... no attributes
- Standard    ... NH HI AS nM
- All         ... NH HI AS nM NM MD jM jI MC ch
***Alignment:
- NH          ... number of loci the reads maps to: =1 for unique mappers, >1 for multimappers. Standard SAM tag.
- HI          ... multiple alignment index, starts with --outSAMattrIHstart (=1 by default). Standard SAM tag.
- AS          ... local alignment score, +1/-1 for matches/mismateches, score* penalties for indels and gaps. For PE reads, total score for two mates. Stadnard SAM tag.
- nM          ... number of mismatches. For PE reads, sum over two mates.
- NM          ... edit distance to the reference (number of mismatched + inserted + deleted bases) for each mate. Standard SAM tag.
- MD          ... string encoding mismatched and deleted reference bases (see standard SAM specifications). Standard SAM tag.
- jM          ... intron motifs for all junctions (i.e. N in CIGAR): 0: non-canonical; 1: GT/AG, 2: CT/AC, 3: GC/AG, 4: CT/GC, 5: AT/AC, 6: GT/AT. If splice junctions database is used, and a junction is annotated, 20 is added to its motif value.
- jI          ... start and end of introns for all junctions (1-based).
- XS          ... alignment strand according to --outSAMstrandField.
- MC          ... mate's CIGAR string. Standard SAM tag.
- ch          ... marks all segment of all chimeric alingments for --chimOutType WithinBAM output.
- cN          ... number of bases clipped from the read ends: 5' and 3'
***Variation:
- vA          ... variant allele
- vG          ... genomic coordinate of the variant overlapped by the read.
- vW          ... 1 - alignment passes WASP filtering; 2,3,4,5,6,7 - alignment does not pass WASP filtering. Requires --waspOutputMode SAMtag.
***STARsolo:
- CR CY UR UY ... sequences and quality scores of cell barcodes and UMIs for the solo* demultiplexing.
- GX GN       ... gene ID and gene name for unique-gene reads.
- gx gn       ... gene IDs and gene names for unique- and multi-gene reads.
- CB UB       ... error-corrected cell barcodes and UMIs for solo* demultiplexing. Requires --outSAMtype BAM SortedByCoordinate.
- sM          ... assessment of CB and UMI.
- sS          ... sequence of the entire barcode (CB,UMI,adapter).
- sQ          ... quality of the entire barcode.
***Unsupported/undocumented:
- ha          ... haplotype (1/2) when mapping to the diploid genome. Requires genome generated with --genomeTransformType Diploid .
- rB          ... alignment block read/genomic coordinates.
- vR          ... read coordinate of the variant.

outSAMattrIHstart.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. start value for the IH attribute
outSAMattrIHstart.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. start value for the IH attribute. 0 may be required by some downstream software, such as Cufflinks or StringTie.

outSAMunmapped.description:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. output of unmapped reads in the SAM format

1st word:
- None
outSAMunmapped.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. output of unmapped reads in the SAM format

1st word:
- None   ... no output
- Within ... output unmapped reads within the main SAM file (i.e. Aligned.out.sam)
2nd word:
- KeepPairs ... record unmapped mate for each alignment, and, in case of unsorted output, keep it adjacent to its mapped mate. Only affects multi-mapping reads.

outSAMorder.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Paired`. type of sorting for the SAM output

Paired: one mate after the other for all paired alignments
PairedKeepInputOrder: one mate after the other for all paired alignments, the order is kept the same as in the input FASTQ files
outSAMorder.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Paired`. type of sorting for the SAM output

Paired: one mate after the other for all paired alignments
PairedKeepInputOrder: one mate after the other for all paired alignments, the order is kept the same as in the input FASTQ files

outSAMprimaryFlag.description:
Type: `string`, example: `OneBestScore`. which alignments are considered primary - all others will be marked with 0x100 bit in the FLAG

- OneBestScore
outSAMprimaryFlag.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `OneBestScore`. which alignments are considered primary - all others will be marked with 0x100 bit in the FLAG

- OneBestScore ... only one alignment with the best score is primary
- AllBestScore ... all alignments with the best score are primary

outSAMreadID.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Standard`. read ID record type

- Standard
outSAMreadID.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Standard`. read ID record type

- Standard ... first word (until space) from the FASTx read ID line, removing /1,/2 from the end
- Number   ... read number (index) in the FASTx file

outSAMmapqUnique.description: Type: `integer`, example: `255`. 0 to 255: the MAPQ value for unique mappers
outSAMmapqUnique.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `255`. 0 to 255: the MAPQ value for unique mappers

outSAMflagOR.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. 0 to 65535: sam FLAG will be bitwise OR'd with this value, i
outSAMflagOR.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. 0 to 65535: sam FLAG will be bitwise OR'd with this value, i.e. FLAG=FLAG | outSAMflagOR. This is applied after all flags have been set by STAR, and after outSAMflagAND. Can be used to set specific bits that are not set otherwise.

outSAMflagAND.description: Type: `integer`, example: `65535`. 0 to 65535: sam FLAG will be bitwise AND'd with this value, i
outSAMflagAND.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `65535`. 0 to 65535: sam FLAG will be bitwise AND'd with this value, i.e. FLAG=FLAG & outSAMflagOR. This is applied after all flags have been set by STAR, but before outSAMflagOR. Can be used to unset specific bits that are not set otherwise.

outSAMattrRGline.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. SAM/BAM read group line
outSAMattrRGline.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. SAM/BAM read group line. The first word contains the read group identifier and must start with "ID:", e.g. --outSAMattrRGline ID:xxx CN:yy "DS:z z z".

xxx will be added as RG tag to each output alignment. Any spaces in the tag values have to be double quoted.
Comma separated RG lines correspons to different (comma separated) input files in --readFilesIn. Commas have to be surrounded by spaces, e.g.
--outSAMattrRGline ID:xxx , ID:zzz "DS:z z" , ID:yyy DS:yyyy

outSAMheaderHD.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. @HD (header) line of the SAM header
outSAMheaderHD.help_text: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. @HD (header) line of the SAM header

outSAMheaderPG.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. extra @PG (software) line of the SAM header (in addition to STAR)
outSAMheaderPG.help_text: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. extra @PG (software) line of the SAM header (in addition to STAR)

outSAMheaderCommentFile.description: Type: `string`. path to the file with @CO (comment) lines of the SAM header
outSAMheaderCommentFile.help_text: Type: `string`. path to the file with @CO (comment) lines of the SAM header

outSAMfilter.description:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. filter the output into main SAM/BAM files

- KeepOnlyAddedReferences
outSAMfilter.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. filter the output into main SAM/BAM files

- KeepOnlyAddedReferences ... only keep the reads for which all alignments are to the extra reference sequences added with --genomeFastaFiles at the mapping stage.
- KeepAllAddedReferences ...  keep all alignments to the extra reference sequences added with --genomeFastaFiles at the mapping stage.

outSAMmultNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. max number of multiple alignments for a read that will be output to the SAM/BAM files
outSAMmultNmax.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. max number of multiple alignments for a read that will be output to the SAM/BAM files. Note that if this value is not equal to -1, the top scoring alignment will be output first

- -1 ... all alignments (up to --outFilterMultimapNmax) will be output

outSAMtlen.description:
Type: `integer`, example: `1`. calculation method for the TLEN field in the SAM/BAM files

- 1
outSAMtlen.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `1`. calculation method for the TLEN field in the SAM/BAM files

- 1 ... leftmost base of the (+)strand mate to rightmost base of the (-)mate. (+)sign for the (+)strand mate
- 2 ... leftmost base of any mate to rightmost base of any mate. (+)sign for the mate with the leftmost base. This is different from 1 for overlapping mates with protruding ends

outBAMcompression.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. -1 to 10  BAM compression level, -1=default compression (6?), 0=no compression, 10=maximum compression
outBAMcompression.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. -1 to 10  BAM compression level, -1=default compression (6?), 0=no compression, 10=maximum compression

outBAMsortingThreadN.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. >=0: number of threads for BAM sorting
outBAMsortingThreadN.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. >=0: number of threads for BAM sorting. 0 will default to min(6,--runThreadN).

outBAMsortingBinsN.description: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. >0:  number of genome bins for coordinate-sorting
outBAMsortingBinsN.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. >0:  number of genome bins for coordinate-sorting

bamRemoveDuplicatesType.description:
Type: `string`. mark duplicates in the BAM file, for now only works with (i) sorted BAM fed with inputBAMfile, and (ii) for paired-end alignments only

- -
bamRemoveDuplicatesType.help_text:
Type: `string`. mark duplicates in the BAM file, for now only works with (i) sorted BAM fed with inputBAMfile, and (ii) for paired-end alignments only

- -                       ... no duplicate removal/marking
- UniqueIdentical         ... mark all multimappers, and duplicate unique mappers. The coordinates, FLAG, CIGAR must be identical
- UniqueIdenticalNotMulti  ... mark duplicate unique mappers but not multimappers.

bamRemoveDuplicatesMate2basesN.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. number of bases from the 5' of mate 2 to use in collapsing (e
bamRemoveDuplicatesMate2basesN.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. number of bases from the 5' of mate 2 to use in collapsing (e.g. for RAMPAGE)

outWigType.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of signal output, e
outWigType.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of signal output, e.g. "bedGraph" OR "bedGraph read1_5p". Requires sorted BAM: --outSAMtype BAM SortedByCoordinate .

1st word:
- None       ... no signal output
- bedGraph   ... bedGraph format
- wiggle     ... wiggle format
2nd word:
- read1_5p   ... signal from only 5' of the 1st read, useful for CAGE/RAMPAGE etc
- read2      ... signal from only 2nd read

outWigStrand.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Stranded`. strandedness of wiggle/bedGraph output

- Stranded
outWigStrand.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Stranded`. strandedness of wiggle/bedGraph output

- Stranded   ...  separate strands, str1 and str2
- Unstranded ...  collapsed strands

outWigReferencesPrefix.description: Type: `string`. prefix matching reference names to include in the output wiggle file, e
outWigReferencesPrefix.help_text: Type: `string`. prefix matching reference names to include in the output wiggle file, e.g. "chr", default "-" - include all references

outWigNorm.description:
Type: `string`, example: `RPM`. type of normalization for the signal

- RPM
outWigNorm.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `RPM`. type of normalization for the signal

- RPM    ... reads per million of mapped reads
- None   ... no normalization, "raw" counts

outFilterType.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Normal`. type of filtering

- Normal
outFilterType.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Normal`. type of filtering

- Normal  ... standard filtering using only current alignment
- BySJout ... keep only those reads that contain junctions that passed filtering into SJ.out.tab

outFilterMultimapScoreRange.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. the score range below the maximum score for multimapping alignments
outFilterMultimapScoreRange.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. the score range below the maximum score for multimapping alignments

outFilterMultimapNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. maximum number of loci the read is allowed to map to
outFilterMultimapNmax.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `10`. maximum number of loci the read is allowed to map to. Alignments (all of them) will be output only if the read maps to no more loci than this value.

Otherwise no alignments will be output, and the read will be counted as "mapped to too many loci" in the Log.final.out .

outFilterMismatchNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. alignment will be output only if it has no more mismatches than this value
outFilterMismatchNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. alignment will be output only if it has no more mismatches than this value.

outFilterMismatchNoverLmax.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.3`. alignment will be output only if its ratio of mismatches to *mapped* length is less than or equal to this value
outFilterMismatchNoverLmax.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.3`. alignment will be output only if its ratio of mismatches to *mapped* length is less than or equal to this value.

outFilterMismatchNoverReadLmax.description: Type: `double`, example: `1.0`. alignment will be output only if its ratio of mismatches to *read* length is less than or equal to this value
outFilterMismatchNoverReadLmax.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `1.0`. alignment will be output only if its ratio of mismatches to *read* length is less than or equal to this value.

outFilterScoreMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. alignment will be output only if its score is higher than or equal to this value
outFilterScoreMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. alignment will be output only if its score is higher than or equal to this value.

outFilterScoreMinOverLread.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.66`. same as outFilterScoreMin, but normalized to read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads)
outFilterScoreMinOverLread.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.66`. same as outFilterScoreMin, but normalized to read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads)

outFilterMatchNmin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. alignment will be output only if the number of matched bases is higher than or equal to this value
outFilterMatchNmin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. alignment will be output only if the number of matched bases is higher than or equal to this value.

outFilterMatchNminOverLread.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.66`. sam as outFilterMatchNmin, but normalized to the read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads)
outFilterMatchNminOverLread.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.66`. sam as outFilterMatchNmin, but normalized to the read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads).

outFilterIntronMotifs.description:
Type: `string`. filter alignment using their motifs

- None
outFilterIntronMotifs.help_text:
Type: `string`. filter alignment using their motifs

- None                           ... no filtering
- RemoveNoncanonical             ... filter out alignments that contain non-canonical junctions
- RemoveNoncanonicalUnannotated  ... filter out alignments that contain non-canonical unannotated junctions when using annotated splice junctions database. The annotated non-canonical junctions will be kept.

outFilterIntronStrands.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `RemoveInconsistentStrands`. filter alignments

- RemoveInconsistentStrands      ... remove alignments that have junctions with inconsistent strands
- None                           ... no filtering

outSJtype.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Standard`. type of splice junction output

- Standard
outSJtype.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Standard`. type of splice junction output

- Standard    ... standard SJ.out.tab output
- None        ... no splice junction output

outSJfilterReads.description:
Type: `string`, example: `All`. which reads to consider for collapsed splice junctions output

- All
outSJfilterReads.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `All`. which reads to consider for collapsed splice junctions output

- All     ... all reads, unique- and multi-mappers
- Unique  ... uniquely mapping reads only

outSJfilterOverhangMin.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `30;12;12;12`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum overhang length for splice junctions on both sides for: (1) non-canonical motifs, (2) GT/AG and CT/AC motif, (3) GC/AG and CT/GC motif, (4) AT/AC and GT/AT motif
outSJfilterOverhangMin.help_text:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `30;12;12;12`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum overhang length for splice junctions on both sides for: (1) non-canonical motifs, (2) GT/AG and CT/AC motif, (3) GC/AG and CT/GC motif, (4) AT/AC and GT/AT motif. -1 means no output for that motif

does not apply to annotated junctions

outSJfilterCountUniqueMin.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `3;1;1;1`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum uniquely mapping read count per junction for: (1) non-canonical motifs, (2) GT/AG and CT/AC motif, (3) GC/AG and CT/GC motif, (4) AT/AC and GT/AT motif
outSJfilterCountUniqueMin.help_text:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `3;1;1;1`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum uniquely mapping read count per junction for: (1) non-canonical motifs, (2) GT/AG and CT/AC motif, (3) GC/AG and CT/GC motif, (4) AT/AC and GT/AT motif. -1 means no output for that motif

Junctions are output if one of outSJfilterCountUniqueMin OR outSJfilterCountTotalMin conditions are satisfied
does not apply to annotated junctions

outSJfilterCountTotalMin.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `3;1;1;1`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum total (multi-mapping+unique) read count per junction for: (1) non-canonical motifs, (2) GT/AG and CT/AC motif, (3) GC/AG and CT/GC motif, (4) AT/AC and GT/AT motif
outSJfilterCountTotalMin.help_text:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `3;1;1;1`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum total (multi-mapping+unique) read count per junction for: (1) non-canonical motifs, (2) GT/AG and CT/AC motif, (3) GC/AG and CT/GC motif, (4) AT/AC and GT/AT motif. -1 means no output for that motif

Junctions are output if one of outSJfilterCountUniqueMin OR outSJfilterCountTotalMin conditions are satisfied
does not apply to annotated junctions

outSJfilterDistToOtherSJmin.description:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `10;0;5;10`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum allowed distance to other junctions' donor/acceptor

does not apply to annotated junctions
outSJfilterDistToOtherSJmin.help_text:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `10;0;5;10`, multiple_sep: `";"`. minimum allowed distance to other junctions' donor/acceptor

does not apply to annotated junctions

outSJfilterIntronMaxVsReadN.description:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `50000;100000;200000`, multiple_sep: `";"`. maximum gap allowed for junctions supported by 1,2,3,,,N reads

i
outSJfilterIntronMaxVsReadN.help_text:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `50000;100000;200000`, multiple_sep: `";"`. maximum gap allowed for junctions supported by 1,2,3,,,N reads

i.e. by default junctions supported by 1 read can have gaps <=50000b, by 2 reads: <=100000b, by 3 reads: <=200000. by >=4 reads any gap <=alignIntronMax
does not apply to annotated junctions

scoreGap.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. splice junction penalty (independent on intron motif)
scoreGap.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. splice junction penalty (independent on intron motif)

scoreGapNoncan.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-8`. non-canonical junction penalty (in addition to scoreGap)
scoreGapNoncan.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-8`. non-canonical junction penalty (in addition to scoreGap)

scoreGapGCAG.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-4`. GC/AG and CT/GC junction penalty (in addition to scoreGap)
scoreGapGCAG.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-4`. GC/AG and CT/GC junction penalty (in addition to scoreGap)

scoreGapATAC.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-8`. AT/AC  and GT/AT junction penalty  (in addition to scoreGap)
scoreGapATAC.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-8`. AT/AC  and GT/AT junction penalty  (in addition to scoreGap)

scoreGenomicLengthLog2scale.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. extra score logarithmically scaled with genomic length of the alignment: scoreGenomicLengthLog2scale*log2(genomicLength)
scoreGenomicLengthLog2scale.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. extra score logarithmically scaled with genomic length of the alignment: scoreGenomicLengthLog2scale*log2(genomicLength)

scoreDelBase.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-2`. deletion extension penalty per base (in addition to scoreDelOpen)
scoreDelBase.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-2`. deletion extension penalty per base (in addition to scoreDelOpen)

scoreInsBase.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-2`. insertion extension penalty per base (in addition to scoreInsOpen)
scoreInsBase.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-2`. insertion extension penalty per base (in addition to scoreInsOpen)

scoreStitchSJshift.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. maximum score reduction while searching for SJ boundaries in the stitching step
scoreStitchSJshift.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. maximum score reduction while searching for SJ boundaries in the stitching step

seedSearchStartLmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. defines the search start point through the read - the read is split into pieces no longer than this value
seedSearchStartLmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. defines the search start point through the read - the read is split into pieces no longer than this value

seedSearchStartLmaxOverLread.description: Type: `double`, example: `1.0`. seedSearchStartLmax normalized to read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads)
seedSearchStartLmaxOverLread.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `1.0`. seedSearchStartLmax normalized to read length (sum of mates' lengths for paired-end reads)

seedSearchLmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. defines the maximum length of the seeds, if =0 seed length is not limited
seedSearchLmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. defines the maximum length of the seeds, if =0 seed length is not limited

seedMultimapNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. only pieces that map fewer than this value are utilized in the stitching procedure
seedMultimapNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. only pieces that map fewer than this value are utilized in the stitching procedure

seedPerReadNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. max number of seeds per read
seedPerReadNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. max number of seeds per read

seedPerWindowNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. max number of seeds per window
seedPerWindowNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. max number of seeds per window

seedNoneLociPerWindow.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. max number of one seed loci per window
seedNoneLociPerWindow.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. max number of one seed loci per window

seedSplitMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `12`. min length of the seed sequences split by Ns or mate gap
seedSplitMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `12`. min length of the seed sequences split by Ns or mate gap

seedMapMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `5`. min length of seeds to be mapped
seedMapMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `5`. min length of seeds to be mapped

alignIntronMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `21`. minimum intron size, genomic gap is considered intron if its length>=alignIntronMin, otherwise it is considered Deletion

alignIntronMax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. maximum intron size, if 0, max intron size will be determined by (2^winBinNbits)*winAnchorDistNbins

alignMatesGapMax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. maximum gap between two mates, if 0, max intron gap will be determined by (2^winBinNbits)*winAnchorDistNbins
alignMatesGapMax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. maximum gap between two mates, if 0, max intron gap will be determined by (2^winBinNbits)*winAnchorDistNbins

alignSJoverhangMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `5`. minimum overhang (i.e. block size) for spliced alignments

alignSJstitchMismatchNmax.description: Type: List of `integer`, example: `0;-1;0;0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. maximum number of mismatches for stitching of the splice junctions (-1: no limit)
alignSJstitchMismatchNmax.help_text:
Type: List of `integer`, example: `0;-1;0;0`, multiple_sep: `";"`. maximum number of mismatches for stitching of the splice junctions (-1: no limit).

(1) non-canonical motifs, (2) GT/AG and CT/AC motif, (3) GC/AG and CT/GC motif, (4) AT/AC and GT/AT motif.

alignSJDBoverhangMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `3`. minimum overhang (i.e. block size) for annotated (sjdb) spliced alignments

alignSplicedMateMapLmin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum mapped length for a read mate that is spliced
alignSplicedMateMapLmin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum mapped length for a read mate that is spliced

alignSplicedMateMapLminOverLmate.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.66`. alignSplicedMateMapLmin normalized to mate length
alignSplicedMateMapLminOverLmate.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.66`. alignSplicedMateMapLmin normalized to mate length

alignWindowsPerReadNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. max number of windows per read
alignWindowsPerReadNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. max number of windows per read

alignTranscriptsPerWindowNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `100`. max number of transcripts per window
alignTranscriptsPerWindowNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `100`. max number of transcripts per window

alignTranscriptsPerReadNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. max number of different alignments per read to consider
alignTranscriptsPerReadNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10000`. max number of different alignments per read to consider

alignEndsType.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Local`. type of read ends alignment

- Local
alignEndsType.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Local`. type of read ends alignment

- Local             ... standard local alignment with soft-clipping allowed
- EndToEnd          ... force end-to-end read alignment, do not soft-clip
- Extend5pOfRead1   ... fully extend only the 5p of the read1, all other ends: local alignment
- Extend5pOfReads12 ... fully extend only the 5p of the both read1 and read2, all other ends: local alignment

alignEndsProtrude.description: Type: `string`, example: `0    ConcordantPair`. allow protrusion of alignment ends, i
alignEndsProtrude.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `0    ConcordantPair`. allow protrusion of alignment ends, i.e. start (end) of the +strand mate downstream of the start (end) of the -strand mate

1st word: int: maximum number of protrusion bases allowed
2nd word: string:
-                     ConcordantPair ... report alignments with non-zero protrusion as concordant pairs
-                     DiscordantPair ... report alignments with non-zero protrusion as discordant pairs

alignSoftClipAtReferenceEnds.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Yes`. allow the soft-clipping of the alignments past the end of the chromosomes

- Yes
alignSoftClipAtReferenceEnds.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Yes`. allow the soft-clipping of the alignments past the end of the chromosomes

- Yes ... allow
- No  ... prohibit, useful for compatibility with Cufflinks

alignInsertionFlush.description:
Type: `string`. how to flush ambiguous insertion positions

- None
alignInsertionFlush.help_text:
Type: `string`. how to flush ambiguous insertion positions

- None    ... insertions are not flushed
- Right   ... insertions are flushed to the right

peOverlapNbasesMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum number of overlapping bases to trigger mates merging and realignment
peOverlapNbasesMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum number of overlapping bases to trigger mates merging and realignment. Specify >0 value to switch on the "merginf of overlapping mates" algorithm.

peOverlapMMp.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.01`. maximum proportion of mismatched bases in the overlap area
peOverlapMMp.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.01`. maximum proportion of mismatched bases in the overlap area

winAnchorMultimapNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. max number of loci anchors are allowed to map to
winAnchorMultimapNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `50`. max number of loci anchors are allowed to map to

winBinNbits.description: Type: `integer`, example: `16`. =log2(winBin), where winBin is the size of the bin for the windows/clustering, each window will occupy an integer number of bins
winBinNbits.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `16`. =log2(winBin), where winBin is the size of the bin for the windows/clustering, each window will occupy an integer number of bins.

winAnchorDistNbins.description: Type: `integer`, example: `9`. max number of bins between two anchors that allows aggregation of anchors into one window
winAnchorDistNbins.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `9`. max number of bins between two anchors that allows aggregation of anchors into one window

winFlankNbins.description: Type: `integer`, example: `4`. log2(winFlank), where win Flank is the size of the left and right flanking regions for each window
winFlankNbins.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `4`. log2(winFlank), where win Flank is the size of the left and right flanking regions for each window

winReadCoverageRelativeMin.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.5`. minimum relative coverage of the read sequence by the seeds in a window, for STARlong algorithm only
winReadCoverageRelativeMin.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.5`. minimum relative coverage of the read sequence by the seeds in a window, for STARlong algorithm only.

winReadCoverageBasesMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum number of bases covered by the seeds in a window , for STARlong algorithm only
winReadCoverageBasesMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum number of bases covered by the seeds in a window , for STARlong algorithm only.

chimOutType.description:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Junctions`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of chimeric output

- Junctions
chimOutType.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Junctions`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of chimeric output

- Junctions       ... Chimeric.out.junction
- SeparateSAMold  ... output old SAM into separate Chimeric.out.sam file
- WithinBAM       ... output into main aligned BAM files (Aligned.*.bam)
- WithinBAM HardClip  ... (default) hard-clipping in the CIGAR for supplemental chimeric alignments (default if no 2nd word is present)
- WithinBAM SoftClip  ... soft-clipping in the CIGAR for supplemental chimeric alignments

chimSegmentMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum length of chimeric segment length, if ==0, no chimeric output
chimSegmentMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum length of chimeric segment length, if ==0, no chimeric output

chimScoreMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. minimum total (summed) score of the chimeric segments

chimScoreDropMax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `20`. max drop (difference) of chimeric score (the sum of scores of all chimeric segments) from the read length
chimScoreDropMax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `20`. max drop (difference) of chimeric score (the sum of scores of all chimeric segments) from the read length

chimScoreSeparation.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. minimum difference (separation) between the best chimeric score and the next one
chimScoreSeparation.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. minimum difference (separation) between the best chimeric score and the next one

chimScoreJunctionNonGTAG.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. penalty for a non-GT/AG chimeric junction
chimScoreJunctionNonGTAG.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. penalty for a non-GT/AG chimeric junction

chimJunctionOverhangMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `20`. minimum overhang for a chimeric junction
chimJunctionOverhangMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `20`. minimum overhang for a chimeric junction

chimSegmentReadGapMax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. maximum gap in the read sequence between chimeric segments
chimSegmentReadGapMax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. maximum gap in the read sequence between chimeric segments

chimFilter.description:
Type: List of `string`, example: `banGenomicN`, multiple_sep: `";"`. different filters for chimeric alignments

- None
chimFilter.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `banGenomicN`, multiple_sep: `";"`. different filters for chimeric alignments

- None ... no filtering
- banGenomicN ... Ns are not allowed in the genome sequence around the chimeric junction

chimMainSegmentMultNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. maximum number of multi-alignments for the main chimeric segment
chimMainSegmentMultNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `10`. maximum number of multi-alignments for the main chimeric segment. =1 will prohibit multimapping main segments.

chimMultimapNmax.description:
Type: `integer`, example: `0`. maximum number of chimeric multi-alignments

- 0
chimMultimapNmax.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `0`. maximum number of chimeric multi-alignments

- 0 ... use the old scheme for chimeric detection which only considered unique alignments

chimMultimapScoreRange.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. the score range for multi-mapping chimeras below the best chimeric score
chimMultimapScoreRange.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. the score range for multi-mapping chimeras below the best chimeric score. Only works with --chimMultimapNmax > 1

chimNonchimScoreDropMin.description: Type: `integer`, example: `20`. to trigger chimeric detection, the drop in the best non-chimeric alignment score with respect to the read length has to be greater than this value
chimNonchimScoreDropMin.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `20`. to trigger chimeric detection, the drop in the best non-chimeric alignment score with respect to the read length has to be greater than this value

chimOutJunctionFormat.description: Type: `integer`, example: `0`. formatting type for the Chimeric
chimOutJunctionFormat.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `0`. formatting type for the Chimeric.out.junction file

- 0 ... no comment lines/headers
- 1 ... comment lines at the end of the file: command line and Nreads: total, unique/multi-mapping

quantMode.description:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. types of quantification requested

- -
quantMode.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. types of quantification requested

- -                ... none
- TranscriptomeSAM ... output SAM/BAM alignments to transcriptome into a separate file
- GeneCounts       ... count reads per gene

quantTranscriptomeBAMcompression.description:
Type: `integer`, example: `1`. -2 to 10  transcriptome BAM compression level

- -2
quantTranscriptomeBAMcompression.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `1`. -2 to 10  transcriptome BAM compression level

- -2  ... no BAM output
- -1  ... default compression (6?)
-  0  ... no compression
-  10 ... maximum compression

quantTranscriptomeBan.description:
Type: `string`, example: `IndelSoftclipSingleend`. prohibit various alignment type

- IndelSoftclipSingleend
quantTranscriptomeBan.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `IndelSoftclipSingleend`. prohibit various alignment type

- IndelSoftclipSingleend  ... prohibit indels, soft clipping and single-end alignments - compatible with RSEM
- Singleend               ... prohibit single-end alignments

twopassMode.help_text:
Type: `string`. 2-pass mapping mode.

- None        ... 1-pass mapping
- Basic       ... basic 2-pass mapping, with all 1st pass junctions inserted into the genome indices on the fly

twopass1readsN.description: Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. number of reads to process for the 1st step
twopass1readsN.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `-1`. number of reads to process for the 1st step. Use very large number (or default -1) to map all reads in the first step.

waspOutputMode.help_text:
Type: `string`. WASP allele-specific output type. This is re-implementation of the original WASP mappability filtering by Bryce van de Geijn, Graham McVicker, Yoav Gilad & Jonathan K Pritchard. Please cite the original WASP paper: Nature Methods 12, 1061-1063 (2015), https://www.nature.com/articles/nmeth.3582 .

- SAMtag      ... add WASP tags to the alignments that pass WASP filtering

soloType.description:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of single-cell RNA-seq

- CB_UMI_Simple
soloType.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of single-cell RNA-seq

- CB_UMI_Simple   ... (a.k.a. Droplet) one UMI and one Cell Barcode of fixed length in read2, e.g. Drop-seq and 10X Chromium.
- CB_UMI_Complex  ... multiple Cell Barcodes of varying length, one UMI of fixed length and one adapter sequence of fixed length are allowed in read2 only (e.g. inDrop, ddSeq).
- CB_samTagOut    ... output Cell Barcode as CR and/or CB SAm tag. No UMI counting. --readFilesIn cDNA_read1 [cDNA_read2 if paired-end] CellBarcode_read . Requires --outSAMtype BAM Unsorted [and/or SortedByCoordinate]
- SmartSeq        ... Smart-seq: each cell in a separate FASTQ (paired- or single-end), barcodes are corresponding read-groups, no UMI sequences, alignments deduplicated according to alignment start and end (after extending soft-clipped bases)

soloCBwhitelist.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. file(s) with whitelist(s) of cell barcodes
soloCBwhitelist.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. file(s) with whitelist(s) of cell barcodes. Only --soloType CB_UMI_Complex allows more than one whitelist file.

- None            ... no whitelist: all cell barcodes are allowed

soloCBstart.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. cell barcode start base
soloCBstart.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. cell barcode start base

soloBarcodeReadLength.description:
Type: `integer`, example: `1`. length of the barcode read

- 1
soloBarcodeReadLength.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `1`. length of the barcode read

- 1   ... equal to sum of soloCBlen+soloUMIlen
- 0   ... not defined, do not check

soloBarcodeMate.description:
Type: `integer`, example: `0`. identifies which read mate contains the barcode (CB+UMI) sequence

- 0
soloBarcodeMate.help_text:
Type: `integer`, example: `0`. identifies which read mate contains the barcode (CB+UMI) sequence

- 0   ... barcode sequence is on separate read, which should always be the last file in the --readFilesIn listed
- 1   ... barcode sequence is a part of mate 1
- 2   ... barcode sequence is a part of mate 2

soloCBposition.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. position of Cell Barcode(s) on the barcode read
soloCBposition.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. position of Cell Barcode(s) on the barcode read.

Presently only works with --soloType CB_UMI_Complex, and barcodes are assumed to be on Read2.
Format for each barcode: startAnchor_startPosition_endAnchor_endPosition
start(end)Anchor defines the Anchor Base for the CB: 0: read start; 1: read end; 2: adapter start; 3: adapter end
start(end)Position is the 0-based position with of the CB start(end) with respect to the Anchor Base
String for different barcodes are separated by space.
Example: inDrop (Zilionis et al, Nat. Protocols, 2017):
--soloCBposition  0_0_2_-1  3_1_3_8

soloUMIposition.description:
Type: `string`. position of the UMI on the barcode read, same as soloCBposition

Example: inDrop (Zilionis et al, Nat
soloUMIposition.help_text:
Type: `string`. position of the UMI on the barcode read, same as soloCBposition

Example: inDrop (Zilionis et al, Nat. Protocols, 2017):
--soloCBposition  3_9_3_14

soloAdapterSequence.description: Type: `string`. adapter sequence to anchor barcodes
soloAdapterSequence.help_text: Type: `string`. adapter sequence to anchor barcodes. Only one adapter sequence is allowed.

soloAdapterMismatchesNmax.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. maximum number of mismatches allowed in adapter sequence
soloAdapterMismatchesNmax.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1`. maximum number of mismatches allowed in adapter sequence.

soloCBmatchWLtype.description:
Type: `string`, example: `1MM_multi`. matching the Cell Barcodes to the WhiteList

- Exact
soloCBmatchWLtype.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `1MM_multi`. matching the Cell Barcodes to the WhiteList

- Exact                           ... only exact matches allowed
- 1MM                             ... only one match in whitelist with 1 mismatched base allowed. Allowed CBs have to have at least one read with exact match.
- 1MM_multi                       ... multiple matches in whitelist with 1 mismatched base allowed, posterior probability calculation is used choose one of the matches.
Allowed CBs have to have at least one read with exact match. This option matches best with CellRanger 2.2.0
- 1MM_multi_pseudocounts          ... same as 1MM_Multi, but pseudocounts of 1 are added to all whitelist barcodes.
- 1MM_multi_Nbase_pseudocounts    ... same as 1MM_multi_pseudocounts, multimatching to WL is allowed for CBs with N-bases. This option matches best with CellRanger >= 3.0.0
- EditDist_2                    ... allow up to edit distance of 3 fpr each of the barcodes. May include one deletion + one insertion. Only works with --soloType CB_UMI_Complex. Matches to multiple passlist barcdoes are not allowed. Similar to ParseBio Split-seq pipeline.

soloInputSAMattrBarcodeSeq.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. when inputting reads from a SAM file (--readsFileType SAM SE/PE), these SAM attributes mark the barcode sequence (in proper order)
soloInputSAMattrBarcodeSeq.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. when inputting reads from a SAM file (--readsFileType SAM SE/PE), these SAM attributes mark the barcode sequence (in proper order).

For instance, for 10X CellRanger or STARsolo BAMs, use --soloInputSAMattrBarcodeSeq CR UR .
This parameter is required when running STARsolo with input from SAM.

soloInputSAMattrBarcodeQual.description: Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. when inputting reads from a SAM file (--readsFileType SAM SE/PE), these SAM attributes mark the barcode qualities (in proper order)
soloInputSAMattrBarcodeQual.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. when inputting reads from a SAM file (--readsFileType SAM SE/PE), these SAM attributes mark the barcode qualities (in proper order).

For instance, for 10X CellRanger or STARsolo BAMs, use --soloInputSAMattrBarcodeQual CY UY .
If this parameter is '-' (default), the quality 'H' will be assigned to all bases.

soloStrand.description:
Type: `string`, example: `Forward`. strandedness of the solo libraries:

- Unstranded
soloStrand.help_text:
Type: `string`, example: `Forward`. strandedness of the solo libraries:

- Unstranded  ... no strand information
- Forward     ... read strand same as the original RNA molecule
- Reverse     ... read strand opposite to the original RNA molecule

soloFeatures.description:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Gene`, multiple_sep: `";"`. genomic features for which the UMI counts per Cell Barcode are collected

- Gene
soloFeatures.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Gene`, multiple_sep: `";"`. genomic features for which the UMI counts per Cell Barcode are collected

- Gene            ... genes: reads match the gene transcript
- SJ              ... splice junctions: reported in SJ.out.tab
- GeneFull        ... full gene (pre-mRNA): count all reads overlapping genes' exons and introns
- GeneFull_ExonOverIntron ... full gene (pre-mRNA): count all reads overlapping genes' exons and introns: prioritize 100% overlap with exons
- GeneFull_Ex50pAS        ... full gene (pre-RNA): count all reads overlapping genes' exons and introns: prioritize >50% overlap with exons. Do not count reads with 100% exonic overlap in the antisense direction.

soloMultiMappers.description:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Unique`, multiple_sep: `";"`. counting method for reads mapping to multiple genes

- Unique
soloMultiMappers.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Unique`, multiple_sep: `";"`. counting method for reads mapping to multiple genes

- Unique     ... count only reads that map to unique genes
- Uniform    ... uniformly distribute multi-genic UMIs to all genes
- Rescue     ... distribute UMIs proportionally to unique+uniform counts (~ first iteration of EM)
- PropUnique ... distribute UMIs proportionally to unique mappers, if present, and uniformly if not.
- EM         ... multi-gene UMIs are distributed using Expectation Maximization algorithm

soloUMIdedup.description:
Type: List of `string`, example: `1MM_All`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of UMI deduplication (collapsing) algorithm

- 1MM_All
soloUMIdedup.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `1MM_All`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of UMI deduplication (collapsing) algorithm

- 1MM_All                     ... all UMIs with 1 mismatch distance to each other are collapsed (i.e. counted once).
- 1MM_Directional_UMItools    ... follows the "directional" method from the UMI-tools by Smith, Heger and Sudbery (Genome Research 2017).
- 1MM_Directional             ... same as 1MM_Directional_UMItools, but with more stringent criteria for duplicate UMIs
- Exact                       ... only exactly matching UMIs are collapsed.
- NoDedup                     ... no deduplication of UMIs, count all reads.
- 1MM_CR                      ... CellRanger2-4 algorithm for 1MM UMI collapsing.

soloUMIfiltering.description:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of UMI filtering (for reads uniquely mapping to genes)

- -
soloUMIfiltering.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, multiple_sep: `";"`. type of UMI filtering (for reads uniquely mapping to genes)

- -                  ... basic filtering: remove UMIs with N and homopolymers (similar to CellRanger 2.2.0).
- MultiGeneUMI       ... basic + remove lower-count UMIs that map to more than one gene.
- MultiGeneUMI_All   ... basic + remove all UMIs that map to more than one gene.
- MultiGeneUMI_CR    ... basic + remove lower-count UMIs that map to more than one gene, matching CellRanger > 3.0.0 .
Only works with --soloUMIdedup 1MM_CR

soloOutFileNames.description:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Solo.out/;features.tsv;barcodes.tsv;matrix.mtx`, multiple_sep: `";"`. file names for STARsolo output:

file_name_prefix   gene_names   barcode_sequences   cell_feature_count_matrix
soloOutFileNames.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `Solo.out/;features.tsv;barcodes.tsv;matrix.mtx`, multiple_sep: `";"`. file names for STARsolo output:

file_name_prefix   gene_names   barcode_sequences   cell_feature_count_matrix

soloCellFilter.description:
Type: List of `string`, example: `CellRanger2.2;3000;0.99;10`, multiple_sep: `";"`. cell filtering type and parameters

- None
soloCellFilter.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `CellRanger2.2;3000;0.99;10`, multiple_sep: `";"`. cell filtering type and parameters

- None            ... do not output filtered cells
- TopCells        ... only report top cells by UMI count, followed by the exact number of cells
- CellRanger2.2   ... simple filtering of CellRanger 2.2.
Can be followed by numbers: number of expected cells, robust maximum percentile for UMI count, maximum to minimum ratio for UMI count
The harcoded values are from CellRanger: nExpectedCells=3000;  maxPercentile=0.99;  maxMinRatio=10
- EmptyDrops_CR   ... EmptyDrops filtering in CellRanger flavor. Please cite the original EmptyDrops paper: A.T.L Lun et al, Genome Biology, 20, 63 (2019): https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-019-1662-y
Can be followed by 10 numeric parameters:  nExpectedCells   maxPercentile   maxMinRatio   indMin   indMax   umiMin   umiMinFracMedian   candMaxN   FDR   simN
The harcoded values are from CellRanger:             3000            0.99            10    45000    90000      500               0.01      20000  0.01  10000

soloOutFormatFeaturesGeneField3.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `Gene Expression`, multiple_sep: `";"`. field 3 in the Gene features
soloOutFormatFeaturesGeneField3.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `Gene Expression`, multiple_sep: `";"`. field 3 in the Gene features.tsv file. If "-", then no 3rd field is output.

soloCellReadStats.description:
Type: `string`. Output reads statistics for each CB

- Standard
soloCellReadStats.help_text:
Type: `string`. Output reads statistics for each CB

- Standard    ... standard output

stranded.description: Type: `string`, default: `yes`, choices: ``yes`, `no`, `reverse``. Whether the data is from a strand-specific assay
stranded.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `yes`, choices: ``yes`, `no`, `reverse``. Whether the data is from a strand-specific assay. 'reverse' means 'yes' with reversed strand interpretation.

minimum_alignment_quality.description: Type: `integer`, default: `10`. Skip all reads with MAPQ alignment quality lower than the given minimum value
minimum_alignment_quality.help_text:
Type: `integer`, default: `10`. Skip all reads with MAPQ alignment quality lower than the given minimum value. 
MAPQ is the 5th column of a SAM/BAM file and its usage depends on the software 
used to map the reads.

type.description: Type: `string`, example: `exon`. Feature type (3rd column in GTF file) to be used, all features of other type are ignored (default, suitable for Ensembl GTF files: exon)
type.help_text: Type: `string`, example: `exon`. Feature type (3rd column in GTF file) to be used, all features of other type are ignored (default, suitable for Ensembl GTF files: exon)

id_attribute.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_id`, multiple_sep: `":"`. GTF attribute to be used as feature ID (default, suitable for Ensembl GTF files: gene_id)
id_attribute.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_id`, multiple_sep: `":"`. GTF attribute to be used as feature ID (default, suitable for Ensembl GTF files: gene_id).
All feature of the right type (see -t option) within the same GTF attribute will be added
together. The typical way of using this option is to count all exonic reads from each gene
and add the exons but other uses are possible as well. You can call this option multiple
times: in that case, the combination of all attributes separated by colons (:) will be used
as a unique identifier, e.g. for exons you might use -i gene_id -i exon_number.

additional_attributes.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_name`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Additional feature attributes (suitable for Ensembl GTF files: gene_name)
additional_attributes.help_text:
Type: List of `string`, example: `gene_name`, multiple_sep: `":"`. Additional feature attributes (suitable for Ensembl GTF files: gene_name). Use multiple times
for more than one additional attribute. These attributes are only used as annotations in the
output, while the determination of how the counts are added together is done based on option -i.

add_chromosome_info.description:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Store information about the chromosome of each feature as an additional attribute
(e
add_chromosome_info.help_text:
Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Store information about the chromosome of each feature as an additional attribute
(e.g. colunm in the TSV output file).

mode.description: Type: `string`, default: `union`, choices: ``union`, `intersection-strict`, `intersection-nonempty``. Mode to handle reads overlapping more than one feature
mode.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `union`, choices: ``union`, `intersection-strict`, `intersection-nonempty``. Mode to handle reads overlapping more than one feature.

non_unique.description: Type: `string`, default: `none`, choices: ``none`, `all`, `fraction`, `random``. Whether and how to score reads that are not uniquely aligned or ambiguously assigned to features
non_unique.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `none`, choices: ``none`, `all`, `fraction`, `random``. Whether and how to score reads that are not uniquely aligned or ambiguously assigned to features.

secondary_alignments.description: Type: `string`, choices: ``score`, `ignore``. Whether to score secondary alignments (0x100 flag)
secondary_alignments.help_text: Type: `string`, choices: ``score`, `ignore``. Whether to score secondary alignments (0x100 flag).

supplementary_alignments.description: Type: `string`, choices: ``score`, `ignore``. Whether to score supplementary alignments (0x800 flag)
supplementary_alignments.help_text: Type: `string`, choices: ``score`, `ignore``. Whether to score supplementary alignments (0x800 flag).

counts_output_sparse.description: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Store the counts as a sparse matrix (mtx, h5ad, loom)
counts_output_sparse.help_text: Type: `boolean_true`, default: `false`. Store the counts as a sparse matrix (mtx, h5ad, loom).

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
